Description: Brownish hematite cylinder seal; the suppliant goddess in a pointed head-dress and a worshipper in a crested cap, with hands clasped, face a seated deified king who holds a wedge-shaped cup. In the field are a star; crescent moon and a "bow-legged dwarf". Roughly cut line border round the bottom of the seal; surface covered with many small scratches but no evidence of recutting.
Bibliographic references: Collon 1986a / Catalogue of the Western Asiatic Seals in the British Museum: Cylinder Seals III: Isin-Larsa and Old Babylonian Periods (70)
Leichty E et al 1988a / Catalogue of the Babylonian Tablets in the British Museum, volume VIII: Tablets from Sippar 3 (p.300)
Condition: Fair; surface covered with many small scratches.
Acquisition name: From: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
